gui

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gui.ChessBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ChessBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A class for showing the chessBoard, the pieces and allowing the user to make moves on the board
    Author:
    Daniele Palazzo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEnPassantSquare(java.lang.String square)
      Adds an en passant square to the board (by adding the last pawn advance to the moves tracker) - used for setting up the board from a FEN string
      private void addMove(Move m)
      Adds a move to the moves tracker and also notifies the table model that is used for displaying the moves in a table
      void clearBoard()
      Empty the board.
      void clearHighlights()
      Clears any square highlights currently displayed on the board
      void clearMoves()
      Delete all the moves played so far

      Gets all the moves played so far in long algebraic notation

        Parameters:
        algebraicNotation - The move that the engine generated represented in long algebraic notation (standard UCI notation)

      • setBoardToFEN

        public void setBoardToFEN(java.lang.String fen)
                   throws InvalidFEN
        Set up the board according to the position stored in the FEN string
        Parameters:
        fen - The FEN string storing the position to set the board to
        Throws:
        InvalidFEN - Thrown if the FEN string is not a valid FEN string

      • addEnPassantSquare

        public void addEnPassantSquare(java.lang.String square)
        Adds an en passant square to the board (by adding the last pawn advance to the moves tracker) - used for setting up the board from a FEN string
        Parameters:
        square - The en passant square (where the enemy piece can move to)

      • getMovesTableModel

        public MovesLogTableModel getMovesTableModel()
        Returns the table model that is required for displaying the moves that have been played so far in a table
        Returns:
        Returns a table model that stores a reference to the moves
